ratings.comment: Not recommended. Stay away!

I took ILS 205 Fall 23 and would highly recommend it. He's a fantastic lecturer- I always felt like I really understood the dense readings after lectures. I had Avramenko himself for discussion and liked it- he really pushed students to think more about the texts and truly listened to everyone's personal thoughts and philosophical ideas.

Don't take class if you want easy humanities credit. Grade is entirely dependent on TA and A's are hard to come by. I didn't read a single of the 7 assigned readings, all I did was show up to every lecture and take notes. He doesn't post anything so lectures are crucial. Finished with an AB.

Amazing prof. Definitely recommend to any incoming freshman or even sophomores. Lectures are usually entertaining and hilarious. Classwork is tolerable, lots of reading, but even if you don't do the readings you'll be fine. Great class and great guy overall.

ILS 205 is very reading heavy, so if you don't have the time to either read the 7+ books, or at least their summaries, I would not recommend. However, if Plato, Aristotle, etc. are people you are interested in, I would absolutely recommend. He is an amazing lecturer. Def my favorite professor I've ever had. Super funny guy.

Avramenko is an incredible lecturer and person. I almost dropped the course after seeing the reading list, but his lectures made me stick around. Really interesting content, and discussions are worthwhile and engaging. Show up/pay attention, do the readings, and study a little, and you should do just fine in the course. Would definitely recommend!

The reading is terrible - it's dry and there's A LOT of it - but Avramenko is a good lecture and tries to make class interesting. The exams aren't too difficult but the papers can be. If you go to class everything's pretty straight forward, if you don't you can still get an A you'll just have a lot of work outside of class.

He's a great lecturer and very intelligent. He does come off as kind of pretentious and arrogant but he knows the material inside and out. Everyone definitely needs to come to class because nothing is posted online. The readings are very heavy . Attendance to lectures aren't necessary but you will have lots of work outside of class.

There is a lot of classical reading involved with ILS 205! If you don't feel comfortable reading Plato, Homer, etc, then this class is not for you. Prof. Avramenko can seem a bit pretentious at times but is overall an excellent lecturer. His lecture outlines are not posted online, so take good notes in class. The exams and 1 paper are fairly easy.

This class is ridiculously easy if you read what's assigned (and have some interest in it) and show up to lecture. Like Avramenko says, he's not trying to trip you up at all - all exam questions are very fair and straightforward. Lecture is so important!! He explains literally everything that could be on the test thoroughly

Avramenko makes an otherwise fairly boring class topic so interesting. So much required reading that I would usually hate, but because he's so entertaining I'm obsessed. Taking 206 next semester because I just love.
Avramenko is an okay professor. His sense of humor comes out during lecture, but can come off as arrogant at times. Overall, the class was easy if the reading is done.

Professor Avramenko is a very smart man, he speaks very clearly and he makes things interesting and easy to understand.  One bad thing about his lectures was his talk about his political beliefs.  Since it was election season I understand it was hard, but it definitely took away from his lectures.

I enjoyed this class, however I found Avramenko's lectures a bit hard to follow at times. Maybe it just didn't vibe with my learning style. I felt that he kind of jumped around on subjects and that made it feel unorganized. He certainly knows what he is talking about though!

I'm in love with ILS 205, I actually signed up for it on accident and it was the best mistake of my life. Avramenko is very funny and engaging. I can actually understand Plato's Republic because of this class. I'm already looking forward to signing up for ILS 206 for next semester.
Hes lectures were very interesting, I learned a lot from the class. His tests were straight forward and you did well in the class if you showed up to class, went to discussion and read the books.

Honestly, I did not like the course material a ton, but Avramenko really makes lectures engaging.  The tests do require some thought, and you need to be good at writing.  Your grade is really up to your TA as they grade everything in the class.  If you are unclear about anything in the class, go to Avramenko's office hours; he is fun to talk to.

Avramenko is awesome. His ILS 205 and 206 courses actually steered me in the direction I'm heading in. Arrogant? Not really. Some people here mistake brilliancy with arrogance, and that's sad. Don't let those reviews turn you away. He's so smart, clear, and hilarious. Take his class!

Prof. Avramenko is an amazing lecturer as he is very funny and interesting. The subject matter is very thought provoking and the readings can be enjoyable if you are into that type of stuff. Show up to lectures, discussion, and read the readings and you'll pass no problem. Would recommend to anyone looking for a humanities.

Hes lectures were very interesting to listen too and i learned a lot from them. His tests were straight forward and you did well in the class if you showed up to class, went to discussion and read the books.
Makes his class very interesting and plays music before each lecture, but assigns a lot of reading.  If you go to class and do the readings, his class is not that difficult

Nice guy, but unnecessary amount of reading and he pulls small vocab out of the text to test you on the final exam. TA completely determines your grade as he grades your paper, and all of your tests. When i had it one TA was noticeable easier so it kind of depends who you have as a TA. DO NOT TAKE UNLESS YOU ENJOY READING BOOKS FROM THE 13t century

Awesome professor! Avramenko is clearly very passionate about the subject and relates things in class to the world. He plays a song at the beginning of every class. Tons of reading, but you can just skim and he'll explain what you need to know.

Engaging lectures that keep your interest. Read the material and the test will be easy. Don't read and struggle with the tests. Highly recommend him and this class for any student no matter the major.

I would've loved this class if not for the fact that the TA determines your entire grade.  Professor Avramenko is one of the coolest, funniest, most knowledgeable professors I've had but the course involves a lot of considerably superfluous reading assignments and an inevitably less qualified TA. I'd rather audit this class than take it for a grade
great class! it is very clear that avramenko loves this subject. the tests aren't that bad if you study and discuss well in your section. taking 206 next semester and i'm excited!

I did not expect to like this class, but I LOVED it. The readings were great and Professor Avramenko was awesome. he played music at the beginning of class that tied into that day's discussion, and it was obvious he loved the topic. if I have a chance to take the "sequel" of this class, I am definitely going to.

Great lecturer. His lecture material is important, since 30% of the tests are from the key terms he defines in class. The rest is on an essay with prompts that are interesting and graded rather easily. Overall good professor, 205 is a take if you need to take some more credits.
Exams have very little to do with what you read.  Go to lecture, study the terms he gives you and you'll do fine.  He maybe a little bit haughty but not to bad.

Great lecturer, so much fun. But his exams suck. Gives you key terms to study, then doesn't use them and expects you to know completely random phrases. So go to lecture and make sure you read everything.

the greatest and most attractive professor probably ever in the history of UW. very interesting lectures, but doesn't post them on the internet so you have to go to class... it's worth it, though - ahh just love him

He gives such great lectures. It's as if he tells each one as a story. The connections he makes are insane and really opened my eyes to what I was missing in my thinking about the world. I guess some people think his intelligence comes off as arrogance, but I don't see it.
Awesome Professor, makes you think and conveys things in a new way that open new ways of thinking

theee best professor ive ever  had. interesting, thought-provoking, abstact. he sarts each lecture with a son, and then relates it to the lecture. can you imagine comparing aerosmith and plato? amazing class; i suggest that everyone take it. a lot of reading, but h explains everything in lecture. grades depend on your t.a. (get a good one!)

He speaks dreadfully slow. Considering the material is interesting, he could have done a lot more with lecture. He comes across as really pompous, but some people dig that. I found it annoying. Since the tests were stupidly constructed, you don't have to read. You should though so you get something out of the class.
Definitely keeps lecture interesting.  Great professor, but your grade really depends on your TA...

A really great class and amazing professor, truly recommended! There is a fair amount of reading, but he basically summarizes most of it in class. After the first 2 or 3 lectures, it really easy to get into the swing of things and understand the style in which he teaches. Any comments on here about how he is pretentious and arrogant are just false.

ILS 205 is a great class.  Yeah, it's hard and you may not get Intermediate credit but it's interesting stuff and relevent to those interested in political science.  You WILL read a lot so keep this in mind but it's a lot of fun.  My favorite class.
He is an interesting guy.

He is really terrible. Just going to say. Within a month, I found him to be a pretentious, self-preening, ass who spends most of his time glorifying his own ego. The class is way harder than the 200 level describes, AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!
he's so cute and funny!
ILS 205:  A 200-level, 3 credit course, that does not count as being "intermediate".  Yet 3 weeks into the semester you are tested over 750+ pages of reading material... Avoid!

I took the Poli Sci Equivalent that meets with ILS 206 and was interesting but ID's were extremely difficult for the Poli Sci Exam. On every exam at least half the IDs I had never seen before. But TA Brandon was amazing.

He is such a funny professor! His tests are mostly identification questions and short answer, and I've never really had a problem with the class. He's also really funny and easy going. I'd recommend taking the class
Some of the best lectures I've been to, hands down. Makes jokes, listens to good music (usually) and relates topics to everyday. The only class I wont skip!

OMG he rocks!  If he hadn't taught the second half of this class second semester I wouldn't have taken it.  You MUST do the reading because he likes to refer to it alot.  He explains things really well, so in discussion there usually aren't too many questions, just review.
Avramenko is the man.  Class is really interesting and not too hard.
He is very interesting and fun to listen to for lectures. Discussions are pointless, and you need to determine the 2 good TA's. THEY determine your grades. Do the readings.

Best class I had all semester. Avramenko comes off as arrogant at first, but then you really start to understand his sarcasm and his reasons for it. Readings are very interesting, and you will learn so much, not just about political science or history, but about life in general. TAKE THIS CLASS!
Full of Youth, fun, tells great stories, and relates to younger generation. Still watches south park. Best prof ever, clearly states ideas in a way that MAKES you want to learn with him.

He is a very enjoyable man. It was always worth going to class. I thought the exams were tough, and my ta was not very good. Try and figure out who the good ta's are because they determine your grade.
Avramenko was my absolute favorite professor. Smart and funny his class was my favorite all year.

Avramenko is the man!  As a repeat student, I think someone needs to spread the word.  Get to know him -- it's worth it and he is incredibly helpful and knowledgeable!  He is awesome and despite his sarcastic exterior actually DOES care about his students -- especially the ones who care about the material.  My favorite prof!
A tough but fair class. Definitely get to know your TA, they can be really helpful in getting the best grade possible in the class....

Interesting lectures.  You have to do A LOT of reading.  A TON of reading.  Some of the reading is interesting and some of the time it is impossible.  Don't expect a cakewalk and your grade is heavily dependent on how your TA likes your writing style.

He's a very good professor. He definetly knows the material and it's clear that he wants everyone else to love it as much as he does. Reading is a necessity. Sometimes it's hard to understand but section can clarify things. Exams are hard but if you read and go to class you're fine. I definately recommend this class.

Avramenko is a really cool guy.3 Tests and a paper, a lot of ways to do well. He keeps lectures interesting and its easy to understand the topics if u can sift thru his lectures. A lot of reading but most of it is very interesting. Get to know ur TA, ur grade is heavily dependant upon how they view ur writing style. Definitely recomend this class.
Tough but fair.
Interesting class, don't have to do the readings. Studying necessary for exams, but a good grade is not hard. Overall, recommended. TA Brandon is by far the best.

He's a good teacher, he thinks his jokes are hilarious (which they usually aren't) but that in itself makes the class more interesting.  He can come off as a jerk, but his lectures are very entertaining and as long as you aren't easily offended he's a fun professor to have.  He gets the info across without boring the**** out of his students.

Good class, young & cool professor, easy to follow.  You can get away without reading but you'd have to study really hard.  T/A's are really good, especially Brandon.  There's one paper and 3 tests, not too bad.  Avramenko is HOT.

Great lectures! As long as you have a general interest in the topic in the first place, not hard at all to enjoy this class. He's brilliant and clearly knows his stuff. He's funny and very relatable to the students. Kind of intimidating to ask questions - he might make fun of you, but he really is a great professor. Loved the course - an easy A
Very good at relating everything to the students
This guy is pretty much my favorite professor. He is a very good lecturer, I never have a hard time paying attention. He's also really funny which always makes class more enjoyable.
In Avramenko's defense: some people need mocking.  His swagger can be a little off-putting, but I don't think anyone can really argue that he doesn't teach well or doesn't know his stuff.

OMG! he didn't care what he said to anyone! anytime someone asked a question, he made fun of them. he spoke too fast in lecture and it was impossible to take notes. don't take a class that he has anything to do with.
Very good lecturer for the most part. Can be a little disorganized at times but usually keeps things interesting. Get Brandon Turner for your TA. He's pretty much my hero.
He's good
Good teacher, sometimes he thinks he's really funny but it was a pretty good class. TA Brandon is the****!
Avramenko is great instructor, sexy and intelligent! willing to teach the materials to you.

In rare fashion, I took 206 before 205, so I had a small leg-up in the class.  But for a  young, new professor, I found him very effective.  Confident, smart, funny/witty, and comfortable up front.  One of the better professors I've ever had - I would suggest his class to anyone considering taking this course.

I actually like the readings, but even if you don't do them he breaks down the topics clearly. The 205/206 courses are interesting, especially if you haven't had philosophy before. Furthermore, he's Canadian and he doesn't mind knocking Bush a bit. Always welcomed. From experience, TA Turner grades harder than Moore, but is a fun guy.

I think the applause he got after his last lecture speeks for itself. Students love this guy, his lectures are interesting, lively and you really don't have to do the reading cuz he summerizes it all for you in lecture. The class was farely easy as the exams, and paper topics were not that challenging whatsoever
He is a great lecturer, very interesting and makes you interested in what he is talking about. He is also really funny!

While the class is interesting, he's a pompous ass. I'm not a big fan. He thinks way too highly of himself, obviously thinks he's attractive and therefore can saywhatever he wants. He thinks he's way funnier than he actually is. I find him annoying, which is unfortunate because so many other people on this site seem to adore him.
I think I'm in love with him.  Enough said.

One of the funnier, better professors. I sat around a lot of people who didn't appreciate him, but I think this is a good prof for a sort of lousy class. whoever said he made this class, they're right. Without him, this would be an awful class. Take him for something like Poli Sci, it would be infinately smarter.

Best class I've ever taken...or I guess best professor I've ever had...he's really funny, liberal, witty, and the lectures are incredibly helpful- the tests are fair also. Plus, as far as professors go, he's not too bad to look at either.

He makes the class.  Without him as the professor, this class would suck.  he is amusing, smart, liberal and an overall great lecturer.  I would recommend this class to anyone and plan on taking the sequel.  Not to mention hes soo CUTE with that canadian accent.

He's really fun and you learn a LOT.  You get to read all the classics that you feel like you SHOULD read at some point in your life, but wouldn't unless you had to.  Prof. Avramenko does a nice job keeping things interesting and relating ancient seemingly obsolete things to modern day.

This is the most raunchy, politically incorrect, and as loud as a professor can get, not to mention that he is unbelievably funny. Not a single lecture goes by without him moking bush or whoever he feels like mocking. I loved this guy's lectures. He's one of those rare professors who actually make you want to come to class. Highly recommended.
